children.text: The brickwork in this area has not been properly jointed in accordance with the contract documents, which detracts from the overall finish of the brickwork.
The Victorian Building Authority’s Guide to Standards and Tolerances clause 3.08 Mortar for masonry states that
‘Mortar is defective if it is not in accordance with the requirements of the Building Code of Australia or the contract specifications’
, and in clause 3.18 Raking of Joints states that
‘Mortar joints in masonry units are defective if they are raked out to a depth of more than 10mm or are not consistent in depth throughout’ .
These defective mortar joints must be rectified in accordance with above.
